Data Structures | Modules | Macros | Functions | Variables
Link Transport Layer (for remote access to system)
Stratify OS
Collaboration diagram for Link Transport Layer (for remote access to system):

Detailed Description

The Link Layer is a desktop API that allows desktop programs to hardware and data on a target board running Stratify OS.

Data Structures

union  link_op_t
 The USB Link Operation Data Structure (Interrupt Out) More...
 
struct  link_reply_t

Variables

int link_errno
 

Macro Definition Documentation

#define LINK_DEV_ERROR

The physical and protocol layers successfully transferred data to/from the device and the command was correctly received. However, there was an error when the device executed the command. For example, calling link_open() on a file that does not exist on the target will return this error.

#define LINK_O_APPEND

Link append flag when opening a file/device.

#define LINK_O_CREAT

Link create flag when opening a file/device.

#define LINK_O_EXCL

Link exclude flag when opening a file/device.

#define LINK_O_NONBLOCK

Link non-blocking flag when opening a file/device.

#define LINK_O_RDONLY

Link read-only flag when opening a file/device.

#define LINK_O_RDWR

Link read-write flag when opening a file/device.

#define LINK_O_TRUNC

Link trunc flag when opening a file/device.

#define LINK_O_WRONLY

Link write-only flag when opening a file/device.

#define LINK_PHY_ERROR

There was an error on the physical layer trying to send/receive data to/from the device. This error can happen if the device is unexpectedly unplugged.

#define LINK_POSIX_TRACE_CRITICAL

Critical/Error event – data is a string

#define LINK_POSIX_TRACE_ERROR

Trace filter changed

#define LINK_POSIX_TRACE_FATAL

Fatal event – data is a string (associate with a crash)

#define LINK_POSIX_TRACE_FILTER

Trace filter changed

#define LINK_POSIX_TRACE_FLUSH_START

Flush start event

#define LINK_POSIX_TRACE_FLUSH_STOP

Flush stop event

#define LINK_POSIX_TRACE_MESSAGE

Message event – data is a string

#define LINK_POSIX_TRACE_OVERFLOW

Beginning of trace overflow

#define LINK_POSIX_TRACE_RESUME

End of trace overflow

#define LINK_POSIX_TRACE_START

Trace started

#define LINK_POSIX_TRACE_STOP

Trace stopped

#define LINK_POSIX_TRACE_UNNAMED_USER_EVENT

Unname user event

#define LINK_POSIX_TRACE_WARNING

Warning event – data is a string

#define LINK_PROT_ERROR

The physical layer successfully sends and receives data, but the device does not ack correctly. This usually happens if a command was partially completed before the host aborted. The protocol needs to be reset with link_resetprot().

#define LINK_S_IFBLK

S_IFBLK equivalent.

#define LINK_S_IFCHR

S_IFCHR equivalent.

#define LINK_S_IFDIR

S_IFDIR equivalent.

#define LINK_S_IFIFO

S_IFIFO equivalent.

#define LINK_S_IFLNK

S_IFLNK equivalent.

#define LINK_S_IFMT

S_IFMT equivalent.

#define LINK_S_IFREG

S_IFREG equivalent.

#define LINK_S_IFSOCK

S_IFSOCK equivalent.

#define LINK_S_IRGRP

S_IRGRP equivalent.

#define LINK_S_IROTH

S_IROTH equivalent.

#define LINK_S_IRUSR

S_IRUSR equivalent.

#define LINK_S_IRWXG

S_IRWXG equivalent.

#define LINK_S_IRWXO

S_IRWXO equivalent.

#define LINK_S_IRWXU

S_IRWXU equivalent.

#define LINK_S_ISGID

S_ISGID equivalent.

#define LINK_S_ISUID

S_ISUID equivalent.

#define LINK_S_ISVTX

S_ISVTX equivalent.

#define LINK_S_IWGRP

S_IWGRP equivalent.

#define LINK_S_IWOTH

S_IWOTH equivalent.

#define LINK_S_IWUSR

S_IWUSR equivalent.

#define LINK_S_IXGRP

S_IXGRP equivalent.

#define LINK_S_IXOTH

S_IXOTH equivalent.

#define LINK_S_IXUSR

S_IXUSR equivalent.

Function Documentation

int link_chmod ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
const char *  path,
int  mode 
)

This changes a file mode.

int link_chown ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
const char *  path,
int  owner,
int  group 
)

This changes file ownership.

int link_close ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
int  fildes 
)

This function closes the device (or regular file) associated with the file descriptor.

Returns
Zero on success or an error code.
int link_close_stdio ( link_transport_phy_t  handle)

This function closes the stdio. return Zero on success or an error code.

int link_closedir ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
int  dirp 
)

This function closes a directory that was previously opened with link_opendir().

Returns
0 on success or an HWPL error code.
Parameters
dirpThe handle for the open directory
int link_exec ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
const char *  file 
)

This function starts a new process on the device.

Returns
Zero on success or an HWPL error code
int link_get_security_addr ( u32 *  addr)

This function reads the address of the security word.

int link_gettime ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
struct tm *  t 
)

This function gets the time on the target device according and stores it in t.

Returns
Zero on success or an error code
int link_ioctl ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
int  fildes,
int  request,
  ... 
)

This function performs ioctl control on device associated with the file descriptor.

Returns
Zero on success or an error code.
int link_kill_pid ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
int  pid,
int  signo 
)

This function sends the specified signal to the specified pid.

int link_lseek ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
int  fildes,
off_t  offset,
int  whence 
)

For block devices, this function moves the access pointer.

Returns
Zero on success or an error code.
int link_mkdir ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
const char *  path,
link_mode_t  mode 
)

This function creates a new directory on the device filesystem.

Returns
0 on success or an HWPL error code.
Parameters
pathThe full path to the directory to create
modeDirectory mode
int link_mkfs ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
const char *  path 
)

This function formats the filesystem. All data is erased from the filesystem leaving an emtpy root directory.

Returns
0 on success or an HWPL error code.
int link_open ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
const char *  path,
int  flags,
  ... 
)

This function opens a file or device on the target.

Returns
The file handle used to read/write/ioctl the file or device; less than zero on an error.
int link_open_stdio ( link_transport_phy_t  handle)

This function opens the stdio. return Zero on success or an error code.

int link_opendir ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
const char *  dirname 
)

This function opens a directory on the device filesystem. link_readdir() may then be used to read the entries in the directory.

Returns
0 on success or an HWPL error code.
Parameters
dirnameThe full path to the directory to open
int link_read ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
int  fildes,
void *  buf,
int  nbyte 
)

This function reads the device (or regular file) associated with the file descriptor.

Returns
The number of bytes read or an error code (less than zero).
int link_read_stdout ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
void *  buf,
int  nbyte 
)

This function reads the standard output from the device.

int link_readdir_r ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
int  dirp,
struct link_dirent *  entry,
struct link_dirent **  result 
)

This function reads an entry from a the directory that was previously opened with link_opendir().

Returns
0 on success or an HWPL error code.
Parameters
dirpThe directory handle
entryA pointer to the destination entry
resultPoints to entry on success
int link_rename ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
const char *  old_path,
const char *  new_path 
)

This renames a file on the filesystem.

int link_rmdir ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
const char *  path 
)

This function removes a directory from the device filesystem.

Returns
0 on success or an HWPL error code.
Parameters
pathThe full path to the directory to remove
int link_settime ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
struct tm *  t 
)

This function sets the time on the target device according to the specified struct tm.

Returns
Zero on success or an error code
int link_symlink ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
const char *  old_path,
const char *  new_path 
)

This function creates a new symbolic link.

Returns
Zero on success or an error code.
int link_unlink ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
const char *  path 
)

This function deletes a file from the device's filesystem.

Returns
Zero on success or an HWPL error code.
Parameters
handleDevice handle
pathThe full path to the file to delete
int link_write ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
int  fildes,
const void *  buf,
int  nbyte 
)

This function writes the device (or regular file) associated with the file descriptor.

Returns
The number of bytes writte or an error code (less than zero).
int link_write_stdin ( link_transport_phy_t  handle,
const void *  buf,
int  nbyte 
)

This function writes the standard input to the device.

Variable Documentation

int link_errno

This is set to the errno value reported on the target device.
